solution_line_template: Penny buys {num_pairs_socks} pairs of socks for ${cost_per_pair} x {num_pairs_socks} = $<<{num_pairs_socks}*{cost_per_pair}={cost_socks}>>{cost_socks}.
In total, Penny spent ${cost_socks} + ${cost_hat} = $<<{cost_socks}+{cost_hat}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on 4 pairs of socks and a hat.
Penny has ${initial_money} -${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left} left after buying 4 pairs of socks and a hat.
